pt: {sc}common{/sc} {sc}ordinary{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} {sc}familiar{/sc} {sc}popular{/sc} {sc}vulgar{/sc} mean generally met with and not in any way special, strange, or unusual. {sc}common{/sc} implies usual everyday quality or frequency of occurrence
and may additionally suggest inferiority or coarseness.
{sc}ordinary{/sc} stresses conformance in quality or kind with the regular order of things.
{sc}plain{/sc} is likely to suggest homely simplicity.
{sc}familiar{/sc} stresses the fact of being generally known and easily recognized.
{sc}popular{/sc} applies to what is accepted by or prevalent among people in general sometimes in contrast to upper classes or special groups.
{sc}vulgar{/sc}, otherwise similar to {sc}popular{/sc}, is likely to carry derogatory connotations (as of inferiority or coarseness).

pt.t: souvenirs designed to appeal to the {it}vulgar{/it} taste

pt: {sc}evident{/sc} {sc}manifest{/sc} {sc}patent{/sc} {sc}distinct{/sc} {sc}obvious{/sc} {sc}apparent{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} {sc}clear{/sc} mean readily perceived or apprehended. {sc}evident{/sc} implies presence of visible signs that lead one to a definite conclusion.
{sc}manifest{/sc} implies an external display so evident that little or no inference is required.
{sc}patent{/sc} applies to a cause, effect, or significant feature that is clear and unmistakable once attention has been directed to it.
{sc}distinct{/sc} implies such sharpness of outline or definition that no unusual effort to see or hear or comprehend is required.
{sc}obvious{/sc} implies such ease in discovering that it often suggests conspicuousness or little need for perspicacity in the observer.
{sc}apparent{/sc} is very close to {sc}evident{/sc} except that it may imply more conscious exercise of inference.
{sc}plain{/sc} suggests lack of intricacy, complexity, or elaboration.
{sc}clear{/sc} implies an absence of anything that confuses the mind or obscures the pattern.

{sc}frank{/sc} {sc}candid{/sc} {sc}open{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} mean showing willingness to tell what one feels or thinks. {sc}frank{/sc} stresses lack of shyness or secretiveness or of evasiveness from considerations of tact or expedience.
{sc}candid{/sc} suggests expression marked by sincerity and honesty especially in offering unwelcome criticism or opinion.
{sc}open{/sc} implies frankness but suggests more indiscretion than {sc}frank{/sc} and less earnestness than {sc}candid{/sc}.
{sc}plain{/sc} suggests outspokenness and freedom from affectation or subtlety in expression.

shortdef: free of impediments to view : unobstructed
